intro: Psychotria cagayanensis, commonly known as the Cagayan psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in lowland and montane forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
